summary: This is a memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with Tijuana Doctor, a Lieutenant at the Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was housed at MCC New York in July and August 2019. The document lists several attachments, including the interview transcript and related prison records.

persons.name: Tijuana Doctor
persons.context: A BOP Lieutenant at MCC New York who was interviewed by the OIG regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. He was part of the Office of Special Investigative Services when Epstein was housed at the facility.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The BOP inmate (Register Number 76318-054) whose death in custody is the subject of the OIG investigation. He was housed at MCC New York in July and August 2019.

connections.description: Doctor was a BOP Lieutenant at MCC New York when Epstein was an inmate housed there, placing him in a law enforcement/custodial role regarding Epstein.

keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) is investigating the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
Tijuana Doctor, a BOP Lieutenant at MCC New York, was interviewed voluntarily on March 16, 2022, as part of this investigation.
Epstein was housed at MCC New York in July and August 2019 under Register Number 76318-054.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, and several documents from August 2019 were attached to the report, including a memorandum by Doctor and prison records.
The document is labeled 'LIMITED OFFICIAL USE' and contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG.
